thread.title: EastEnders' Danny Dyer 'forced to QUIT after worrying bosses with party lifestyle'
thread.title_full: EastEnders' Danny Dyer 'forced to QUIT after worrying bosses with party lifestyle'

title: EastEnders' Danny Dyer 'forced to QUIT after worrying bosses with party lifestyle'
text: EastEnders' Danny Dyer 'forced to QUIT after worrying bosses with party lifestyle' EastEnders' Danny Dyer 'forced to QUIT after worrying bosses with party lifestyle' EASTENDERS star Danny Dyer has been forced to suddenly quit the soap because of his party animal behaviour, reports are claiming. PUBLISHED: 22:54, Thu, Feb 16, 2017 | UPDATED: 23:01, Thu, Feb 16, 2017 It's been suggested that the 39-year-old actor - who plays Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter - has halted filming after talking with BBC bosses. According to The Sun, the East London native will be off of work for a number of weeks, with insiders citing his "drunk" behaviour at the National Television Awards as part of the problem. A source told the publication: "The producers are concerned about him for a number of reasons. GETTY â€¢ BBC Danny Dyer has been 'forced to quit EastEnders' according to reports Related articles
